module.description: VPBE On Screen Display Subsystem (spec version: 1.00.w.11)

bitfield.description: Cb/Cr or Cr/Cb format This bit selects the order of the input data relative to the placement of the Cb and Cr components

OSD Window Vertical Expansion Enable When enabled, the bitmap window images are stretched by a factor of 6/5 in the vertical direction. Results in proper vertical sizing to display a normal VGA (640x480) image on a PAL television (720x576); i.e., 480 x 6/5=576

OSD Window Horizontal Expansion Enable When enabled, the bitmap window images are stretched by a factor of 9/8 in the horizontal direction. Results in proper horizontal sizing to display a normal VGA (640x480) image on a PAL / NTSC television (720);

Expansion Filter Enable Valid when either VVRSZ or VHRSZ is on, or video window smoothing is set. Caution is required when using the filter since expansion filter memory can only correspond to 720 horizontal pixels. *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window Vertical Expansion Enable When enabled, the video window images are stretched by a factor of 6/5 in the vertical direction. Results in proper vertical sizing to display a normal VGA (640x480) image on a PAL television (720x576); i.e., 480 x 6/5=576 *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window Horizontal Expansion Enable When enabled, the video window images are stretched by a factor of 9/8 in the horizontal direction. Results in proper horizontal sizing to display a normal VGA (640x480) image on an NTSC/PAL television (720x???); i.e., 640 x 9/8 = 720 *This bit is latched by VD.
Field signal inversion *This bit is latched by VD.
Background CLUT selection Selects look-up table for background color display *This bit is latched by VD.
Background Color CLUT Specifies the image display background color by CLUT address. In parts that do not display the image, color specified by this register is displayed.
Video Window 1 Expansion filter coefficient Note: When VVRSZ and EF are set to 1, this bit is valid

bitenum.description: same coefficients for field-0 and field-1
different coefficients for field-0 and field-1

bitfield.description: Video Window 0 horizontal direction zoom *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 vertical direction zoom *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 0 display mode In Field mode, only the number of lines in a field, as specified in VIDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory and the data is repeated for each field sent to the VENC module. In Frame mode, 2x the number of lines in a field, as specified in VIDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory, with the data being interleaved for each field sent to the VENC module. This provides full vertical resolution of 2x VIDWIN1YL. *This bit is latched by VD.
Sets image display on/off Video Window 0 *This bit is latched by VD.
Video window 0 Expansion filter coefficient Note: When VVRSZ and EF are set to 1, this bit is valid

bitenum.description: same coefficients for field-0 and field-1
different coefficients for field-0 and field-1

bitfield.description: Video Window 0 horizontal direction zoom *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 vertical direction zoom *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 0 display mode In Field mode, only the number of lines in a field, as specified in VIDWIN0YL, will be read from display memory and the data is repeated for each field sent to the VENC module. In Frame mode, 2x the number of lines in a field, as specified in VIDWIN0YL, will be read from display memory, with the data being interleaved for each field sent to the VENC module. This provides full vertical resolution of 2x VIDWIN0YL. *This bit is latched by VD.
Sets image display on/off Video Window 0 *This bit is latched by VD.

RGB input for window 0 Enable Note: When RGB0E bit in OSDWIN0MD register is set/enabled, RGB1E should not be set to 1 (parallel use is not allowed). The following equation is used to calculate YcbCr when RGB0E is set to 1. Y = 0.2990*R + 0.5870*G + 0.1140*B Cb = -0.1687*R - 0.3313*G + 0.5000*B + Offset(128) Cr = 0.5000*R - 0.4187*G - 0.0813*B + Offset(128)
CLUT select for OSD Window 0 Selects look-up table that is used for OSD Window0 *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window0 Horizontal Zoom *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window0 Vertical Zoom *This bit is latched by VD.

Bitmap bit width for OSD window 0 *This bit is latched by VD. Note: This is valid only for bitmap type, and when the OSD window is in RGB input mode, bit width is automatically set to 16-bit and this register setting is ignored
Blending Ratio for OSD Window 0 Sets blending ratio of OSD Window 0 and Video Window 0 *This bit is latched by VD.

Transparency Enable for OSD Window 0 When Transparency is disabled, the entire bitmap window is blended with the video windows according to BLND0. Bitmap Mode When Transparency is enabled, blending is only performed for pixels whose bitmap value is 0, according to BLND0. RGB Mode When Transparency is enabled and the pixel value is the same as TRANSPVAL, the YCbCr data converted from RGB value and video windows are blended according to the blending ratio specified in BLND0. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 0 Display Mode In Field mode, only the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN0YL, will be read from display memory and the data is repeated for each field sent to the VENC module. In Frame mode, 2x the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN0YL, will be read from display memory, with the data being interleaved for each field sent to the VENC module. This provides full vertical resolution of 2x OSDWIN0YL. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 0 Active (displayed) *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 Attribute Mode Enable This bit enables attribute mode for OSD WindoW0. *This bit is latched by VD.

RGB input for window 1 Enable OASW=0 Note: When RGB0E bit in OSDWIN1MD register is set/enabled, RGB0E should not be set to 1 (parallel use is not allowed). The following equation is used to calculate YcbCr when RGB1E is set to 1. Y = 0.2990*R + 0.5870*G + 0.1140*B Cb = -0.1687*R - 0.3313*G + 0.5000*B + Offset(128) Cr = 0.5000*R - 0.4187*G - 0.0813*B + Offset(128)
CLUT Select for OSD Window 1 OASW=0 Selects look-up table that is used for OSD WindoW 0
OSD WindoW 1 Horizontal Zoom OASW=0 *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD WindoW 1 Vertical Zoom OASW=0 *This bit is latched by VD.
Bitmap Bit Width for OSD Window 1 OASW=0 Bitmap bit width for OSD WindoW0 *This bit is latched by VD.
Blending Ratio for OSD WindoW 1 OASW=0 Sets blending ratio of OSD window 1 and Video Window 0 *This bit is latched by VD.

Transparency Enable for OSD Window 1 OASW=0 When Transparency is disabled, the entire bitmap window is blended with the video windows according to BLND1. Bitmap Mode When Transparency is enabled, blending is only performed for pixels whose bitmap value is 0, according to BLND1. RGB Mode When Transparency is enabled and the pixel value is the same as TRANSPVAL, the YCbCr data converted from RGB value and video windows are blended according to the blending ratio specified in BLND1. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 1 Display Mode OASW=0 In Field mode, only the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory and the data is repeated for each field sent to the VENC module. In Frame mode, 2x the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory, with the data being interleaved for each field sent to the VENC module. This provides full vertical resolution of 2x OSDWIN1YL. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 Active (displayed) OASW=0 *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 Attribute Mode Enable This bit enables attribute mode for OSD WindoW0. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Attribute Window Horizontal Zoom OASW=1 *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD WindoW0 or Attribute Window Vertical Zoom OASW=1 *This bit is latched by VD.
Blinking Interval OASW=1 Specifies the blinking interval of the attribute window in units of 8 VD pulses *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Attribute Window Display Mode OASW=1 In Field mode, only the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory and the data is repeated for each field sent to the VENC module. In Frame mode, 2x the number of lines in a field, as specified in OSDWIN1YL, will be read from display memory, with the data being interleaved for each field sent to the VENC module. This provides full vertical resolution of 2x OSDWIN1YL. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Attribute Window Blink Enable OASW=1 *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Color Palette Address
CLUT Select *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Horizontal Line Width Width is 4xRCHW, with 0 interpreted as 1 pixel Range is: 1,4,8,16,20,24,28 pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Vertical Line Width Width is 2xRCVW, with 0 interpreted as 1 line Range is: 1,2,4,6,8,10,12,14 lines *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Active (displayed) *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 0 Line Offset Number of burst transfers (32-bytes) in a horizontal line. Video data format is YCbYCr, or 32-bits per 2 pixels, which gives 16-pixels/burst: Line width in pixels/16 e.g., 720/16 = 45 (0x2D) Note: If line width setting for the window result in a non-integer value, round the value up to the next larger integer and organize the data in SDRAM so that each line begins on a burst boundary. *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 1 Line Offset Number of burst transfers (32-bytes) in a horizontal line. Video data format is YCbYCr, or 32-bits per 2 pixels, which gives 16-pixels/burst: Line width in pixels/16 e.g., 720/16 = 45 (0x2D) Note: If line width setting for the window result in a non-integer value, round the value up to the next larger integer and organize the data in SDRAM so that each line begins on a burst boundary. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 0 Line Offset Number of burst transfers (32-bytes) in a horizontal line. This depends on OSD window bit depth: Line width in pixels * bitdepth/256-bits/burst e.g., 64*8/256 = 2 Example: Offsets for 256 pixels horizontal: 1-bit mode : ((256x 1)/8)/32 = 1(0x0001) 2-bit mode : ((256x 2)/8)/32 = 2(0x0002) 4-bit mode : ((256x 4)/8)/32 = 4(0x0004) 8-bit mode : ((256x 8)/8)/32 = 8(0x0008) RGB565 mode : ((256x16)/8)/32 = 16(0x0010) Note: If line width and bitdepth settings for the window result in a non-integer value, round the value up to the next larger integer and organize the data in SDRAM so that each line begins on a burst boundary. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 1 Line Offset Number of burst transfers (32-bytes) in a horizontal line. This depends on OSD window bit depth: Line width in pixels * bitdepth/256-bits/burst e.g., 64*8/256 = 2 Example: Offsets for 256 pixels horizontal: 1-bit mode : ((256x 1)/8)/32 = 1(0x0001) 2-bit mode : ((256x 2)/8)/32 = 2(0x0002) 4-bit mode : ((256x 4)/8)/32 = 4(0x0004) 8-bit mode : ((256x 8)/8)/32 = 8(0x0008) RGB565 mode : ((256x16)/8)/32 = 16(0x0010) Note: If line width and bitdepth settings for the window result in a non-integer value, round the value up to the next larger integer and organize the data in SDRAM so that each line begins on a burst boundary. *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 0 SDRAM Source Address The SDRAM source address is an absolute byte address. Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte (burst) boundary. As a result, the 5 LSB's are ignored and reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. *This bit is latched by VD.

Video Window 1 SDRAM Source Address The SDRAM source address is an absolute byte address. Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte (burst) boundary. As a result, the 5 LSB's are ignored and reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 0 SDRAM Source Address The SDRAM source address is an absolute byte address. Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte (burst) boundary. As a result, the 5 LSB's are ignored and reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. *This bit is latched by VD.

OSD Window 1 SDRAM Source Address The SDRAM source address is an absolute byte address. Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte (burst) boundary. As a result, the 5 LSB's are ignored and reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. *This bit is latched by VD.
Base Pixel in X Horizontal base display reference position for all windows. Specified as number of pixels from HD. Value is 24-512 *This bit is latched by VD.

Base Pixel(Line) in Y vertical base display reference position for all windows. Specified as number of pixels(lines) from VD. Value used is MAX(BPY,1), i.e., minumum value is 1. *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 X-Position Horizontal display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPX) *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 Y-Position Vertical display start position - number of pixels/lines from display reference position (BASEPY) *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 X-Width Horizontal display width in pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 0 Y-Height Vertical display height in pixels/lines NOTE: In frame mode, specify in terms of lines/field. *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 1 X-Position Horizontal display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPX) *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 1 Y-Position Vertical display start position - number of pixels/lines from display reference position (BASEPY) *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 1 X-Width Horizontal display width in pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
Video Window 1 Y-Height Vertical display height in pixels/lines NOTE: In frame mode, specify in terms of lines/field. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 0 X-Position Horizontal display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPX) *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 0 Y-Position Vertical display start position - number of pixels/lines from display reference position (BASEPY) *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 0 X-Width Horizontal display width in pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 0 Y-Height Vertical display height in pixels/lines NOTE: In frame mode, specify in terms of lines/field. *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 X-Position Horizontal display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPX) *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 Y-Position Vertical display start position - number of pixels/lines from display reference position (BASEPY) *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 X-Width Horizontal display width in pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
OSD Window 1 Y-Height Vertical display height in pixels/lines NOTE: In frame mode, specify in terms of lines/field. *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Window X-Position Horizontal display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPX) *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Window Y-Position Vertical display start position - number of pixels from display reference position (BASEPY) *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Window X-Width Horizontal display width in pixels *This bit is latched by VD.
Rectangular Cursor Window Y-Height Vertical display height in pixels/lines NOTE: In frame mode, specify in terms of lines/field. *This bit is latched by VD.

TI Test #1

bitenum.description: All registers are loaded with default values

bitfield.description: TI Test #0
Video Window 0/1 Expansion filter coefficient Inverse Note: When V1EFC or V0EFC is set, this bit is valid
Attenuation Enable for REC601
Attenuation Enable for REC601
Video Window RGB Mode Enable
Video Window to use for RGB Mode
TI Internal Test Set to 0
CLUT ROM Selection
CLUT Write Busy Used when writing CLUT data to RAM.
Ping-pong buffer toggle select When PPRV=0: 0: Use address in VIDWIN0ADR 1: Use address in PPVWIN0ADR When PPRV=1 0: Use address in PPVWIN0ADR 1: Use address in VIDWIN0ADR
Ping-pong buffer Reverse Inverts polarity of internal select signal. Affects PPSW
Reserved Set to 0
Write data (Y) into built-in CLUT-RAM
Write data (Cb) into built-in CLUT-RAM
Write data (Cr) into built-in CLUT-RAM
CLUT Write Pallette Address
OSD Window transparency value for RGB565 input mode

Ping-pong Video Window 0 Address The SDRAM source address is an absolute byte address. Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte (burst) boundary. As a result, the 5 LSB's are ignored and reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. *This bit is latched by VD.
